metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3772 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s IP framework for transformingpackets (XFRM subsystem). This issue may allow a malicious user withCAP_NET_ADMIN privileges to directly dereference a NULL pointer inxfrm_update_ae_params(), leading to a possible kernel crash and denial ofservice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-lowlatency - 4.4.0-246.280
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-lowlatency - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-kvm - 4.4.0-1125.135
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1162-aws - 4.4.0-1162.177
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1162.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-gcp - 4.15.0-1156.173~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1125-oracle - 4.15.0-1125.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-246.280').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.135').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1162.177').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.175~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.173~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1125.136~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
